verses.verse: Call <S%H7121><s%> now, <S%H4994><s%> if there be <S%H3426><s%> any that will answer <S%H6030><s%> thee; and to <S%H413><s%> which <S%H4310><s%> of the saints <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6918><s%> wilt thou turn? <S%H6437><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> wrath <S%H3708><s%> killeth <S%H2026><s%> the foolish <S%H191><s%> man, and envy <S%H7068><s%> slayeth <S%H4191><s%> the silly <S%H6601><s%> one.
I <S%H589><s%> have seen <S%H7200><s%> the foolish <S%H191><s%> taking root: <S%H8327><s%> but suddenly <S%H6597><s%> I cursed <S%H5344><s%> his habitation. <S%H5116><s%>

His children <S%H1121><s%> are far <S%H7368><s%> from safety, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3468><s%> and they are crushed <S%H1792><s%> in the gate, <S%H8179><s%> neither <S%H369><s%> is there any to deliver <S%H5337><s%> them.

Whose <S%H834><s%> harvest <S%H7105><s%> the hungry <S%H7457><s%> eateth up, <S%H398><s%> and taketh <S%H3947><s%> it even out of <S%H413><s%> the thorns, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6791><s%> and the robber <S%H6782><s%> swalloweth up <S%H7602><s%> their substance. <S%H2428><s%>

Although <S%H3588><s%> affliction <S%H205><s%> cometh not forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H3808><s%> of the dust, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6083><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> doth trouble <S%H5999><s%> spring <S%H6779><s%> out of the ground; <S%H4480><s%> <S%H127><s%>
Yet <S%H3588><s%> man <S%H120><s%> is born <S%H3205><s%> unto trouble, <S%H5999><s%> as the sparks <S%H1121><s%> <S%H7565><s%> fly <S%H5774><s%> upward. <S%H1361><s%>
I <S%H589><s%> would seek <S%H1875><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> God, <S%H410><s%> and unto <S%H413><s%> God <S%H430><s%> would I commit <S%H7760><s%> my cause: <S%H1700><s%>
Which doeth <S%H6213><s%> great things <S%H1419><s%> and unsearchable; <S%H369><s%> <S%H2714><s%> marvelous things <S%H6381><s%> without <S%H5704><s%> <S%H369><s%> number: <S%H4557><s%>

Who giveth <S%H5414><s%> rain <S%H4306><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the earth, <S%H776><s%> and sendeth <S%H7971><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the fields: <S%H2351><s%>
To set up <S%H7760><s%> on high <S%H4791><s%> those that be low; <S%H8217><s%> that those which mourn <S%H6937><s%> may be exalted <S%H7682><s%> to safety. <S%H3468><s%>
He disappointeth <S%H6565><s%> the devices <S%H4284><s%> of the crafty, <S%H6175><s%> so that their hands <S%H3027><s%> cannot <S%H3808><s%> perform <S%H6213><s%> their enterprise. <S%H8454><s%>
He taketh <S%H3920><s%> the wise <S%H2450><s%> in their own craftiness: <S%H6193><s%> and the counsel <S%H6098><s%> of the froward <S%H6617><s%> is carried headlong. <S%H4116><s%>
They meet <S%H6298><s%> with darkness <S%H2822><s%> in the daytime, <S%H3119><s%> and grope <S%H4959><s%> in the noonday <S%H6672><s%> as in the night. <S%H3915><s%>

But he saveth <S%H3467><s%> the poor <S%H34><s%> from the sword, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2719><s%> from their mouth, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6310><s%> and from the hand <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3027><s%> of the mighty. <S%H2389><s%>
So the poor <S%H1800><s%> hath <S%H1961><s%> hope, <S%H8615><s%> and iniquity <S%H5766><s%> stoppeth <S%H7092><s%> her mouth. <S%H6310><s%>

Behold, <S%H2009><s%> happy <S%H835><s%> is the man <S%H582><s%> whom God <S%H433><s%> correcteth: <S%H3198><s%> therefore despise <S%H3988><s%> not <S%H408><s%> thou the chastening <S%H4148><s%> of the Almighty: <S%H7706><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> he <S%H1931><s%> maketh sore, <S%H3510><s%> and bindeth up: <S%H2280><s%> he woundeth, <S%H4272><s%> and his hands <S%H3027><s%> make whole. <S%H7495><s%>
He shall deliver <S%H5337><s%> thee in six <S%H8337><s%> troubles: <S%H6869><s%> yea, in seven <S%H7651><s%> there shall no <S%H3808><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> touch <S%H5060><s%> thee.
In famine <S%H7458><s%> he shall redeem <S%H6299><s%> thee from death: <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4194><s%> and in war <S%H4421><s%> from the power <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3027><s%> of the sword. <S%H2719><s%>

Thou shalt be hid <S%H2244><s%> from the scourge <S%H7752><s%> of the tongue: <S%H3956><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shalt thou be afraid <S%H3372><s%> of destruction <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7701><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> it cometh. <S%H935><s%>

At destruction <S%H7701><s%> and famine <S%H3720><s%> thou shalt laugh: <S%H7832><s%> neither <S%H408><s%> shalt thou be afraid <S%H3372><s%> of the beasts <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2416><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> thou shalt be in league <S%H1285><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> the stones <S%H68><s%> of the field: <S%H7704><s%> and the beasts <S%H2416><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> shall be at peace <S%H7999><s%> with thee.

And thou shalt know <S%H3045><s%> that thy tabernacle <S%H168><s%> shall be in peace; <S%H7965><s%> and thou shalt visit <S%H6485><s%> thy habitation, <S%H5116><s%> and shalt not sin. <S%H3808><s%> <S%H2398><s%>
Thou shalt know <S%H3045><s%> also that <S%H3588><s%> thy seed <S%H2233><s%> shall be great, <S%H7227><s%> and thine offspring <S%H6631><s%> as the grass <S%H6212><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>
Thou shalt come <S%H935><s%> to <S%H413><s%> thy grave <S%H6913><s%> in a full age, <S%H3624><s%> like as a shock of corn <S%H1430><s%> cometh in <S%H5927><s%> in his season. <S%H6256><s%>
Lo <S%H2009><s%> this, <S%H2063><s%> we have searched <S%H2713><s%> it, so <S%H3651><s%> it <S%H1931><s%> is; hear <S%H8085><s%> it, and know <S%H3045><s%> thou <S%H859><s%> it for thy good.
